On Tue, Jul 14, 2009 at 5:11 PM, Gord=
on Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:

>
>
> That's generally the right appro=
ach.
>
> Can you find more of the exception stack, perhaps in heritrix_out.=
log?
> (The 'IllegalStateException' and anything that caused/preceded it wo=
uld
> help.)
>
> Especially if the previous crawl still had full queues at =
the time it
> ended (and perhaps even if not), you might want to take the e=
xtra step
> of copying *just* the history info out of the previous crawl's =
'state'
> directory into the new crawl. (The main() of PersistProcessor pro=
vides a
> standalone facility for doing so between runs.) However, skipping=
 this
> step shouldn't cause problems; just a somewhat larger state directo=
ry
> and (perhaps) slower startup.
>
> There are no known problems with thi=
s functionality in Heritrix 2.0.x,
> but I still generally advise using 1.1=
4.3 unless the enhanced
> frontier-prioritization features of 2.0 (related =
to custom 'precedence'
> policies) are needed.
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
>
> Igna=
cio Garcia wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hello,
> >
> > We are trying to set up dedupe=

> > some issues launching the Re=
crawl jobs.
> > We have no problems adding the processors needed for the in=
itial crawl:
> >
> > 1. FetchHistoryProcessor, after the last fetching proc=
essor.
> > 2. PersistStoreProcessor, after all other processors.
> >
> > Wh=
en that first job is finished, a grep "uri_history" on the state files
> > =
shows that one of the jdb files matches, so it seems that some
> > informat=
ion is being written to it.
> > After that, we are creating a new ready job=
, using the completed initial
> > crawl as the base (so that the state is c=
opied over) and adding the
> > required load processor:
> >
> > 1. PersistL=
oadProcessor, before any fetch processor
>
> >
> > We also keep the FetchHi=
story and PersistStore, to have a cumulative
> > history of the crawls
> >
=
> > However, when we try to start this Recrawl job, with all three
> > proc=
essors, I get the following exception:

      <p>That's gene=
rally the right approach.<br>
<br>
Can you find more of the exception stack=
, perhaps in heritrix_out.log? <br>
(The 'IllegalStateException' an=
d anything that caused/preceded it would <br>
help.)<br>
<br>
Especially if=
 the previous crawl still had full queues at the time it <br>
ended (and pe=
rhaps even if not), you might want to take the extra step <br>
of copying *=
just* the history info out of the previous crawl's 'state' <br>=

directory into the new crawl. (The main() of PersistProcessor provides a <=
br>
  standalone facility for doing so between runs.) However, skipping thi=
s <br>
step shouldn't cause problems; just a somewhat larger state dire=
ctory <br>
and (perhaps) slower startup.<br>
<br>
There are no known proble=
ms with this functionality in Heritrix 2.0.x, <br>
but I still generally ad=
vise using 1.14.3 unless the enhanced <br>
frontier-prioritization features=
 of 2.0 (related to custom 'precedence' <br>
policies) are needed.<=
br>
<br>
- Gordon @ IA</p><div class=3D"im"><br>
